content.p: ONI is a distributed object and remote procedure call system implemented using YAML on top of TCP/IP or HTTP.

YAML is quite suitable for the serialization of objects required by remote object access protocols. The simplicity of the protocal makes short work of setup and is one of the primary benefits that ONI has over other systes such as SOAP and XML-RPC.

ONI only works with Ruby, but it should be easy enough to generalize to other languages that support YAML. It is also very alpha, but nonetheless it has been put to work under more realistic conditions and it looks promising.

ONI has sitting around my harddirve for years now, comllecting digital dust. When I first put it together I was hevily into learning YAML and it seemed like one fo the natural places to put YAML to good use. However, YAML has yet to really catch fire, JSON seems to have stolen most of it's glory. And though YAML is fairly popular among RUby circles, Ruby already has drb, so it's not like there was a pressing need for a YAML based alternative. So ONI never matured past the initial prototype implementation.
REgardless I recently decided that it was foolish not to at least "put it out there". Perhaps someone else will come across it and have the inspiration to take it to the next production ready level.

pre.code: $ tar -xzf oni-x.y.z.tar.gz $ cd oni-x.y.z $ ruby setup.rb

content.p: Linux/Unix users might need to use sudo ruby setup.rb.
For detailed usage documentation, please refer to the RDocs.
